description:
Stacki is an open source  bare metal provisioning tool that can take your servers from bare hardware (or virtual hardware) to working Linux, ready to install applications. Stacki does this at scale, so deploying 1000+ servers is no more complex than deploying one.  This includes parallel installation of your servers configuration of things such as:

DNS
DHCP, TFTP, PXE 
parallel execution shell
cluster networking
multiple distributions
host discovery
host assignment via spreadsheet
partition configuration
storage controller configuration 
Once your servers are installed with Stacki, you can augment them with configuration tools like Puppet, Chef, Salt, CFEngine, Ansible, etc.  Along with an introduction to Stacki, Anoop will discuss how the Hadoop team at PayPal used Stacki to deploy 288 servers in 14 minutes and how they continue to use Stacki today.

Link to Bio: https://www.linkedin.com/in/anooprajendra
title: LinuxFest Northwest 2016: Stacki - Open Source Linux Server Provisioning Tool
